main event: A bright white spherical object was spotted in the sky over Grand Rapids, Michigan on April 5, 1952.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be the size of a ping pong ball.
The object traveled at a very high rate of speed, covering 5/8 of the sky in 16-18 seconds.
The object was initially reported as a possible aircraft or meteor by the witness.
The Air Force concluded that the object was likely a weather balloon based on the witness description and calculated altitude and speed.
The report mentions that there was no evidence of electronic observation of the object.
